page.title: 07RUISLIP LIBRARY TODAY
page.content: The library in Ruislip used to be the Little Barn of the Manor Farm and is now the central building of the Manor Farm Leisure Complex. It has a fox shaped weather vane. It has a children's part and an adult's part. The adult's part has got reading books that are pretty difficult to read. There are about 5 areas where you can sit and read a newspaper or book kept in the library. There is a part of the library where juniors or seniors do their homework. Also there is a photo-copier that costs 10p. To take some books out of the library you have to ask for some tickets then you are a member. There are some videos in the children's section. The children's librarian runs events during the holidays. If you want to leave your baby there for a while there is a cot.
